children.name: num_cols
children.label: How many columns do you want?

children.name: icon_type
children.label: What kind of icon would you like to use?
children.help_text: If you select Font Awesome and want to use their PRO ICONS, you will need to have a FA-Pro paid account and go through a few setup steps.  See my documentation page hubpsothero.com/commodore-documentation for more info.

children.name: custom_icon_size
children.label: Custom Icon Size
children.help_text: If you'd like to set a custom icon size that's different than your global setting, toggle this on so the slider below is activated.

children.name: size
children.label: Icon Size:
children.help_text: Set the size of your Font Awesome Icon

children.name: custom_color
children.label: Icon Color:
children.help_text: Please select the custom color you'd like applied to these icons.

children.name: icon_upload
children.label: Upload an Icon:
children.help_text: Upload your icon file here. Make sure you upload a transparent PNG.

children.name: lottie_embed
children.label: Paste Lottie Player Embed Code
children.help_text: When pasting the code DO NOT include the line that starts with "script".  IMPORTANT: To ensure the animated image is responsive on all screen sizes, set the width to 100% and remove the height property (style="width=100%")   See commodore documentation for directions.

children.name: icon_fa
children.label: Paste Font Awesome Free/Pro Code:
children.help_text: The code you need to copy from Font Awesome will look like this:

children.name: content
children.label: Rich Text Editor:
children.default:
Headline Here

This is where you can add some extra copy.

children.name: test
children.label: Test:
children.inline_help_text: This is currently a test. Please disregard.

children.name: bg_color
children.label: Background Color:
children.help_text: Select the color you'd like for the entire background.

children.name: shadow
children.label: Want to add a subtle shadow?

children.name: add_wave_top
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Top):
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the top of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color:
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row above.

children.name: add_wave_btm
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Bottom):
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the base of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color:
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row below.

children.name: padding_top
children.label: Padding Top (Desktop):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like above the content in the row.

children.name: padding_bottom
children.label: Padding Bottom (Desktop):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like below the content in the row.

children.name: padding_top_tablet
children.label: Padding Top (Tablet):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like above the content in the row when viewing on a tablet in portrait mode.

children.name: padding_bottom_tablet
children.label: Padding Bottom (Tablet):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like below the content in the row when viewing on a tablet in portrait mode.

children.name: padding_top_mobile
children.label: Padding Top (Mobile):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like above the content in the row when viewing on a mobile phone in portrait mode.

children.name: padding_bottom_mobile
children.label: Padding Bottom (Mobile):
children.help_text: This is the amount of spacing that you would like below the content in the row when viewing on a mobile phone in portrait mode.

children.name: visibility
children.label: ██████ Show this Row on:
children.help_text: This section will let you control whether or not the row is visible on different devices.
